message.content:
Here's an example code to make a scatter plot comparing two columns in a dataframe:

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# create a sample dataframe
df = pd.DataFrame({'x': [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 'y': [2, 4, 6, 8, 10]})

# plot the scatter plot
plt.scatter(df['x'], df['y'])

# add labels and title to the plot
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('y')
plt.title('Scatter Plot')

# show the plot
plt.show()
```

This will produce a scatter plot with the x-axis representing the values in the 'x' column and the y-axis representing the values in the 'y' column. The plot will have a blue dot for each data point. You can modify the code to change the color, marker style, and other plot properties as needed..
